executive_summary: Awareness of the economic and societal benefits of behavioral health treatment has strengthened psychiatrists' role in the healthcare sector. Rising incomes and broader insurance coverage have also facilitated access to psychiatric care in recent years. The pandemic deepened the mental health crisis in the US, creating an unprecedented need for outpatient mental health providers – including psychiatrists. While psychiatrists have been vital to addressing these needs, hiring challenges, inflation and regulatory pressures strain an already overburdened industry. Despite recent headwinds, revenue has been increasing at a CAGR of 0.6% to an estimated $17.9 billion over the past five years, including expected growth of 0.4% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Mental Health Crisis Augments Psychiatrists' Role
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Destigmatization and a growing acceptance of the societal, personal and economic benefits of mental health treatment, including psychiatric care, have supported the industry's growth. The pandemic exacerbated rates of mental illness, leading demand for psychiatrists to climb to a record high. Telemedicine was vital for psychiatrists to maintain patient volumes throughout 2020 and 2021, with virtual visits remaining a preferred method post-pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Care backlogs will keep demand high for psychiatrists in 2024
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A huge unmet need from adolescent patients will support rising spending from this age group.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Telehealth Alleviates the Burden of a Challenging Labor Market
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Workforce growth hasn't kept pace with rising demand for years, while an exodus of healthcare workers during the pandemic coupled with high rates of burnout worsened preexisting shortages. Telehealth is helping psychiatry providers curb staffing shortages by connecting psychiatrists to larger patient pools and improving work-life balance. But patients' broad acceptance of telehealth also poses a threat from telepsychiatry apps.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand for Psychiatric Care Will Remain at an All-Time High
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The pandemic increased rates of mental illness, deepening the unmet need and keeping demand for psychiatrists at an unprecedented high moving forward. Spending on psychiatric treatment will be supported by policies expanding access and out-of-pocket spending, especially for adolescents and medication management.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Shortages in the psychiatric workforce will be more extreme
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number seeking psychiatric treatment will outpace the supply of providers due to population growth, lack of residency slots, low reimbursement rates and an aging workforce. More practices will adopt technology to lessen the burden, while consolidation helps larger practices navigate adoption costs and regulations.

industry_definition: Psychiatrists are medical doctors specializing in the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of mental illnesses and emotional disorders.

threats: Low - steady Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid

key_trends: A deepening mental health crisis is pouring over into psychiatry offices. Psychiatrists continue to confront backlogs of care and long wait times nearly four years after the pandemic initially exacerbated rates of mental illness.
Telehealth has reshaped how psychiatrists deliver care. While virtual psychiatry appointments have become the status quo, telehealth's future role depends on how the regulatory environment evolves.
Psychiatrists navigate regulations at the federal and state level. A complex regulatory environment determines the how, where and to what extent providers can operate.
Public policies aimed at the behavioral health space indirectly support psychiatrists. Recent efforts to destigmatize mental illness and strengthen the workforce benefit psychiatry providers.
Private health plans are the largest payers of psychiatrists
Providing general psychiatric care to adult patients is the industry's primary focus
Insurers determine how much psychiatrists receive for patient care
Educational and licensing requirements limit the extent of substitutes
A movement toward multispecialty providers and large groups has changed the industry's landscape
Regulatory, legal and educational requirements create steep hurdles for new psychiatrists

market_segmentation.segment_description: Reimbursements from private payors include payments received from commercial health plans.
Out-of-pocket payments include payments by patients or family members for any care not covered by insurance.
Public insurance includes reimbursements from Medicaid and Medicare to healthcare providers for services they deliver to eligible beneficiaries.
Other sources of revenue also include contributions and payments for non-patient care to healthcare practitioners and government funding.

products_and_services.product_description: General psychiatric care includes comprehensive mental health services that address a wide range of mental and emotional issues for adult patients.
Children and adolescent psychiatric care addresses a range of mental and emotional issues found in younger patients.
Psychiatrists have a central role in managing various health challenges that older adults confront, including neurocognitive, sleep and anxiety disorders.
Psychiatrists have a central role in delivering treatment, including medication-assisted treatment, for patients who struggle with a substance use disorder.

tier_2_suppliers: Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Health & Medical Insurance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: PSYCHIATRIST SHORTAGES DOESN'T SLOW DOWN DEMAND FOR GENERAL PSYCHIATRIC CARE
demand_determinants.determinant_description: An enormous need for mental health services and an undersupply of psychiatrists hurt access but will keep demand for general psychiatric care steep through 2024.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: PSYCHIATRY PROVIDERS NAVIGATE AN UNPRECEDENTED DEMAND FROM CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Reported rates of anxiety, depression and other mental health conditions in adolescents have been expanding in recent years. Increasing awareness and acceptance of conditions like autism and ADHD is also encouraging more parents to diagnose and treat their children proactively.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: DEMOGRAPHIC AND SOCIETAL TRENDS BRING GERIATRIC AND ADDICTION CARE INTO THE SPOTLIGHT
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Worsening rates of substance abuse in the US have brought addiction treatment into the public eye. Destigmatization and growing acceptance of the benefits of psychiatric treatment have encouraged some older adults to seek care.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: DIVERSE MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS EXPAND PSYCHIATRISTS' SCOPE
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Psychiatrists often offer a variety of specialties to address the varied and complex nature of mental health conditions.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region includes Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Ohio and Wisconsin.
The Mid-Atlantic region includes New Jersey, New York and Pennsylvania.
The New England region includes Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island and Vermont.
The Plains region includes Iowa, Kansas, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, North Dakota and South Dakota.
The Rocky Mountains region includes Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Utah and Wyoming.
The Southeast region includes Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia and West Virginia.
The Southwest region includes Arizona, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas.
The West region includes Alaska, California, Hawaii, Nevada, Oregon and Washington.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Industry assistance level is low to steady.

factors_decreased_barrier.factor: Globalization level is low to steady.
Competition level is low to steady.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages are the single-largest expense for psychiatry providers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are the single-largest expense for psychiatry providers, responsible for over half of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages have grown faster than revenue
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have grown faster than revenue has over the past five years. A shortfall of psychiatrists and an undersized mental health workforce pressures wage growth as clinics vie to attract and retain qualified clinical and non-clinical staff.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor shortages create burnout, cause errors and weaken patient care
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Labor shortages create burnout, cause errors and weaken patient care. High rates of burnout have encouraged employees to consider other employment opportunities outside of the industry, contributing to additional wage hikes.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patents and concentration of patents
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served by incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: No substitutes can replicate psychiatric treatment
volatility_points.volatility_description: People struggling with a mental illness or emotional disorder can find help through multiple healthcare providers and settings. Still, psychiatrists have a unique role in the mental health care space that other providers can't replicate.

A dependence on reimbursements from public and commercial insurers introduces volatility. Changes in regulations, payor mixes, payment rates and insurance coverage determine revenue but can be challenging to navigate.

FAQs.question: What is the document about?
FAQs.answer: The document contains industry data tables with information such as revenue, employment, exports, and other economic indicators for a particular industry over the years 2010 to 2021.
